clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: I don't take that for granted... for someone to choose you, it is an honor.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Kristee speaks plainly and honestly, no corporate fluff. She uses natural pauses and simple language to convey deep conviction about service.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It reframes the grind of client service from obligation to privilege — a perspective shift that could reignite purpose for agents who've lost the fire.

HOOK.text: The $50 million producer who still answers her phone at 9 PM just said something that made me stop.
HOOK.production_note: B-roll: Kristee on phone in evening, soft lighting. Cut to close-up of her face mid-conversation, engaged and present.

SETUP.text: Kristee Leonard has been in luxury real estate for 18 years. She's seen thousands of transactions. And yet — she still treats every single client call like it's the first one she ever got.
SETUP.production_note: Quick montage: Awards, closing table photos, testimonials flashing. Then cut back to Kristee, grounded and real.

INSIGHT.text: Here's what she said: 'I don't take that for granted... for someone to choose you, it is an honor.' Not a transaction. Not a commission check. An honor. She means it. When Zillow transfers a lead, she doesn't introduce herself first — she asks when they want to see the house. Because they already chose her. That choice? That's the whole game. Most agents forget this after year three. They start seeing clients as interruptions. Kristee sees them as the reason she still gets to do this work.
INSIGHT.production_note: Feature Kristee's actual quote as text overlay. Cut to footage of her at showings, closings, genuinely engaged with clients. No staged smiles — real moments.

REFRAME.text: If you've been in this business long enough to feel the grind, this is your reminder: Every person who calls you passed on a hundred other agents. They didn't choose your brand. They chose you. That's not pressure. That's privilege.
REFRAME.production_note: Slow push-in on Kristee's face as she delivers the quote. Authentic, no music. Let the weight land.

CTA.text: So here's the question: When's the last time you answered the phone like it was an honor? Not an obligation. An honor. Try it tomorrow. See what shifts.
CTA.production_note: End card: 'When's the last time you answered like it was an honor?' Clean text, no logo. Let it sit for 2 seconds.

caption: She's done $50M+ and still answers at 9 PM. Here's why that matters more than her production numbers.
